page.title: 11BOWLING HARBOUR
page.content: Bowling is a{small community}of about{450 people.}Most of the{houses are of the{older tenement}type,which are now{privately owned,}plus a few {council flats,}and the rest{privately {built bungalows, villas or semi- {detached houses. The{Forth and Clyde canal}has its {beginning}here and is{linked}to the river Clyde by a series of{locks. In days past, the canal{provided}an {efficient}method of{transport}serving the whole of the Clyde Valley, but{now it and the harbour are{rarely used except for a few boats moored there. The village has a small{distillery, the{"Little Mill"}which once{employed {many}of the local{people.}However, recent{advances in mechanisation}and the{decline}in the{whisky trade}has meant{redundancies}and even the possibility of closure in the future.
